segments.script:
"Welcome home, Appalachia! So I was talking to this settler at Harpers Ferry and they said... word is, there's a secret underground bunker hidden somewhere in the Cranberry Glades. Now, I know what you're thinking - probably just another wild rumor. But apparently, someone's seen some flickering lights down there after dark. I mean, it could be anything from raiders to ghouls or even...well, who knows? A group of survivors like us trying to stay hidden?

Anyways, it got me wondering if anyone else has heard anything about this supposed bunker. You know how these kinds of stories spread in the wasteland. If you have any info, please share! We're all explorers and detectives here at Appalachia Radio."

"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone." 

Hey y'all, Julie here on Appalachia Radio. I've got a rumor that's been floating around lately - word is, some folks have spotted strange creatures near the old Grafton Dam. Apparently they're like giant crabs, but with shells made of junk and scrap metal! Can you imagine? Like something out of a post-apocalyptic fairy tale.

Someone told me these... critters are attracted to water, so if you're heading that way for a drink or a dip, just watch your step, okay? I haven't seen 'em myself, but then again, I don't get out to Grafton Dam too often. Maybe they're just urban legends at this point. But hey, wouldn't it be something if they really did exist?

Anyway, that's the latest weirdness I've heard about from around Appalachia. Stay safe out there, and keep those ears tuned in for more tunes and tidbits on your favorite local radio station!"

segments.script:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

You know, I heard there's this hidden underground bunker somewhere out in the wasteland. Apparently it's got all sorts of pre-war tech and even some Vault-Tec vault dwellers who never left their home. Someone told me they've been seen wandering the tunnels, still in their Vault 76 jumpsuits! 

Word is, if you can find that place... you might score some pretty sweet loot. Plus, imagine the stories those folks could tell about life before the Great War. But honestly, I don't know if any of it's true. The wasteland's full of rumors, right?

Anyway, enough gossip for now. Let's focus on the music! Here's "The End" by Jimi Hendrix. It's one of my personal favorites - hope you enjoy it too, out there in Appalachia.

Stay safe and keep your ears open for more tunes!

(continues playing music)

segments.script:
"Hey there, folks! Julie here on your favorite Appalachia Radio station. I got a rumor for ya that's been floating around... Word is, there's a secret underground bunker hidden somewhere in the woods, filled with pre-war tech and supplies. segments.script:
"Welcome home, Appalachia! 

So I heard from someone who swears on their stash of Nuka-Cola, that there's been more sightings of those mutated wild west critters called Scorched lately. You know, the ones with all that radiation seeping out of 'em? Well, apparently they've gotten even bolder and are venturing deeper into the foothills. Someone told me a group of Vault Dwellers saw one near Flatwoods recently, just kinda shambling around like it owned the place!

Now, I don't know if I believe every wild rumor that comes my way, but word is these Scorched might be more aggressive than before. Maybe it's just their nature finally shining through after all those years of being mostly harmless... or maybe something else entirely has them feeling feisty. Either way, if you do happen to cross one in the wilderness, remember: keep your wits about you and don't go poking sticks at 'em! 

That's all for now, folks. Stay safe out there!"

segments.script:
Hey there, friends! Julie here on Appalachia Radio. I've got some interesting rumors to share that someone told me about while passing through Harpers Ferry recently. Word is... the Scorched might not be all they're cracked up to be. Apparently, a few folks who used to be part of those groups have turned away from their violent ways and are now trying to help rebuild.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Julie, how can we trust them?" And that's totally fair. But the person who told me this said they've seen these former Scorched helping out in settlements, fixing roads, even working with traders to get vital supplies where they're needed most.

Of course, it's hard to verify stories like this when you're always on the move. But I do think it's worth keeping an open mind and being willing to give people a second chance... don't you? Anyway, that's all for now. Back to the tunes - how about some good ol' bluegrass while we reflect on the complexities of life in the wasteland? Stay safe out there!

Welcome home, Appalachia.

So I heard from someone who knows someone that there's these strange glowing plants growing around the old nuclear power plant, you know? The one near Oak Insulators. Apparently they light up like neon at night! Word is they might even be edible if you cook 'em just right.

Now, I don't know about trying any radioactive vegetables myself, but hey, desperate times and all that. Just thought I'd pass it along in case anyone's looking for a new food source out there.

segments.script:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys. Hey there, wastelanders! Got some rumors I heard floating around while I was out exploring.

Word is... there's a hidden vault down in the Mire that wasn't part of the initial 76 batch. Apparently, it's got some unique loot and stuff. But nobody's found it yet, so take it for what it's worth.

Someone told me they spotted a pack of Scorchbeasts heading east from Harpers Ferry a few days back. Now, I know those critters can travel far, but still - that's a long ways to wander without finding food or water!

I heard rumors of a new trader setting up shop in the old Abandoned Bog Mine. Apparently they've got some nice gear and even do repairs. Just don't ask me where, 'cause I don't know! Guess you'll have to find them yourself.

That's all for now, folks. Take care out there, and remember - the radio's always here, keeping things lively in Appalachia! See ya on the next broadcast!

"You know how sometimes you hear rumors flyin' around out there in the wasteland? I mean, like about strange creatures or hidden treasures? Anyway, just thought I'd pass on those little bits of wasteland gossip. You never know what's true and what ain't out here. But that's half the fun, right? The mystery and speculation."

segments.script:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys. So, I heard this rumor about some people finding an old, abandoned Vault hidden deep in the caves... Word is, they think it's even older than Vault 76! Can you imagine? Someone told me there might've been other Vaults before those were built. Crazy thought, right?

I mean, who knows if it's true. But hey, a little mystery never hurt anyone. And honestly, the idea of exploring an undiscovered Vault is pretty exciting. Just think about all the secrets and stories hidden down there! Maybe we'll find some old terminals with playlists from before the bombs dropped.

Anyway, enough speculation for now. Let's get back to the music, shall we? Here's a classic - "Country Roads" by John Denver. I hope you're all enjoying it out there in Appalachia, wherever your travels take you. Stay safe, and remember... even amidst all this uncertainty, we've got each other, and our love for these hills.

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia! So you know how there's rumors of mutated creatures out in the wilds? Well, I heard something interesting from a friend who ventured into the woods recently. Apparently, they stumbled upon this tiny settlement that's been taking in these... creature orphans? Yeah, that's what they call them.

Word is, someone with medical skills has been finding and rescuing these mutated babies - dogs, cats, even a bear cub! They're being cared for and raised as regular pets. Can you imagine having one of those critters as a companion out in the wasteland? I mean, it's not like we can't find companionship elsewhere, but I guess there's something special about these creatures.

I'm not saying this is true or anything - my friend's just the rumor mill, ya know? But if there are folks out there making a difference for these poor, mixed-up critters... well, that's some real heart in the wasteland. And hey, we could all use a little more of that!
